result.execSummary:
The defendant Gonzalo Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gonzalo Gonzalez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Fine was paid off with $500 of bond money posted in 15-CM-107, which was due to this Defendant as reimbursement for joint and several restitution.

ADDRESS INFO for Gonzalo Gonzalez
Current: 1685 Windsor Drive,  #4, Green Bay, WI 54302 United States  (Effective: 01-29-2016)
Prior: 1844 Florida St, Apt. C, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States

Defendant Gonzalo Gonzalez in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State reviews offer, advises that restitution remains unpaid. Defendant has restitution, leaves with DA to pay restitution.  DA/Defendant return. State advises that restitution and surcharge have been paid in full. Court questions Defendant regarding waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 2. Court reviews concept of party to a crime. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Gonzalo Gonzalez in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews motion from Defense. Defendant advises that what she requested was not what they agreed on. Defendant gets paid Friday, can retain new lawyer if Court will grant time, is working at Georgia Pacific. Court thinks he will have to grant Defense's motion, removes case from trial docket. State advises that Defense advised in November that case would not go to trial. Court will give Defendant time to retain counsel, will try to get case back on trial docket pretty quickly. Discussion regarding offer from State, which will remain on the table until next lawyer comes on board. Court reviews options, including possibility of waiver of right to counsel.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Gonzalo Gonzalez in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on failure to appear. Defendant thought Court was on the 7th. State advises that's a Saturday. Defendant was confused on dates, talked to Defense on Friday. Defendant advises that he likes half of the offer, not the other half. Court suggests that case be set for trial and pre-trial, questions State on length of trial. Set for one day trial and pre-trial.

Attorney Megan Carollo in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense's office spoke with Defendant, who is en route. Message left for Defendant from courtroom. Defense advises of contact with Defendant, who thought Court was scheduled for November 7, not November 2. Defense advises that case is resolved, would have needed time to speak with Defendant and request plea/sentencing within 30 days. Court questions whether Defense has regular contact with Defendant. State requests warrant, has no objection to staying warrant for 24-48 hours. Court orders warrant, grants Defense 48 hours to get in touch with Defendant. If located, case can be put on 11/9 at 10:00. Defendant must be present, Defense can appear by phone.

Defendant Gonzalo Gonzalez in court with attorney Megan Carollo. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of discovery received, has not had opportunity to review interviews, requests another status conference.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Gonzalo Gonzalez in court with attorney Megan Carollo. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with RV, MS.

Defendant Gonzalo Gonzalez in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Bond set. Defendant thinks he lost his job.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gonzalo Gonzalez
